iterations.description: AltGr (sent as Ctrl+Alt on Windows) is likely being intercepted by mRemoteNG's keyboard hook before reaching the remote session, breaking input for European keyboard layouts.

comments.author: mheden
comments.snippet:
I see the same issue. Sometime when having mRemoteNG open the AltGr stop working in my host os. When I'm closing mRemoteNG the button starts working again.

Also Win10 and double screen configuration (though I'm not sure the double screen matter).

comments.author: simonai1254
comments.snippet:
That's not a mRemoteNG but a RDP thing. Just restart all RDP sessions and you are good to go. mRemoteNG can't do anything about it.

And in case you need to use AltGr and can't restart everything first, use Ctrl+Alt instead.

comments.snippet: Triage refresh (P2): this issue has been inactive for a long time. Please retest on the latest build and share reproducible steps, expected vs actual behavior, and logs/screenshots. If there is no confirmation/update, maintainers can close it as stale or not reproducible.

notes:
AI triage (claude): AltGr (sent as Ctrl+Alt on Windows) is likely being intercepted by mRemoteNG's keyboard hook before reaching the remote session, breaking input for European keyboard layouts.
Approach: Detect AltGr (Right Alt / Ctrl+Alt combination via e.KeyData or WM_KEYDOWN with extended key flag) in the key interception layer and allow it to pass through without consuming the synthetic Ctrl press; mirror the dead-key fix applied in #1742 for VNC and the scan-code fix in #1728 for RDP.
